pros: Great pay, simple tasks, friendly staff
cons: Extremely boring and you have to be able to to accept refusals for donations

pros: Interesting interaction with CU professors and their research
cons: No job training. No job guidance. Unresponsive HR. Unpredictable and unsupervised decisions regarding promotions and demotions.
Pay could be a little higher.

pros: The training program is excellent. The culture overall was very positive and supportive. The pay was pretty good and competitive which they made a point of making sure it was on par with other positions of the same type. The benefits were great. Good contact with people in high places.
cons: Very political and bureaucratic environment. No room for creativity, everything had to be done a certain way and the work was very administrative which might be good for some. The environment was boring.

pros: If you like mindless work and horrible management... this is the job for you.  Only benefit is the time off, but that doesn't help when you actually have to go work in a place like this.
cons: The Processing and Records Department is a revolving door.  With a staff of roughly 10 people, about 4-5 people quit a year there.  You think they would like at the head manager who has been there for a while?  The work would be tolerable if the boss actually showed interest in the employees.  The boss is too busy with her other job to care about the employees.  The environment is horrible in that office.

job_title: Business Systems Analyst in Loveland, CO
pros: work life balance, excellent on-site training, great benefits, small non-profit made for great networking
cons: Changes in upper management with no replacement hires, some departments not competitive with salary for work being done
